content.question:
<math alttext="X gas plus Y gas is in equilibrium with X Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>X(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>â‡„</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>XY(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

The particle diagram above illustrates the changes that take place when <math alttext="X gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are placed inside a rigid container at constant temperature. Which of the following is a characteristic of a system at equilibrium that is best represented by the particle diagram?

choices.label: The particle diagram shows that initially the reaction proceeds to the right to form products, which is a characteristic of a system at equilibrium.

The particle diagram shows that after <math alttext="200 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> the rate of the reverse reaction is slower than the rate of the forward reaction, which is a characteristic of a system at equilibrium.

The particle diagram shows that after <math alttext="200 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> there are no observable changes in the amounts of reactants and products, which is a characteristic of a system at equilibrium.

The particle diagram shows that between <math alttext="0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="200 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> the rates of the forward and reverse reactions are the same, which is a characteristic of a system at equilibrium.

content.answer: The particle diagram shows that after <math alttext="200 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> there are no observable changes in the amounts of reactants and products, which is a characteristic of a system at equilibrium.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
